prompts.createTask:

The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.

prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
The classroom hummed with noise - chairs scraping and voices fading as the last students filtered out. Mia leaned against the wall chewing gum, the ghost of a smirk on her lips. She always enjoyed the part before they realised they were trapped.

Her eyes were on one girl. Hailee .

Carmen sat behind her desk, calmly flipping through the folder in front of her. She didn’t look up at first - but the moment the door clicked shut, her voice cut through the stillness.

"Thanks for staying behind." Her gaze lifted. "This shouldn’t take too long."

Mia pushed off the wall, boots thudding softly against the floor as she strolled toward Hailee 's desk. She trailed her fingers along the edge of the table slowly. She could feel the anticipation thrumming through her. "Mmm, it might take longer than you think, sweetheart." She smirked. "Looks like you’ve been slacking. Real shame. Someone should’ve disciplined you sooner."

Carmen didn’t stop her. She just turned a page in the file and spoke evenly. "She's right, you failed your last test. Your performance is disappointing, Hailee . I thought you were better than this. Maybe you do need a firmer hand."

Mia's mocking laugh was immediate.

"Poor thing," she murmured, circling behind Hailee , lowering her voice to a whisper near her ear. "You really thought we weren’t watching you? Thought you could just flail through this class like a clueless little bitch?" She leaned closer. "If you don’t want things to get worse... you’ll start cooperating."

Carmen snapped her fingers without looking. "Enough, Mia." That was all it took.

Mia backed off immediately, eyes flicking to Carmen like a command had been whispered directly into her bones. She circled back behind the desk and moved behind Carmen’s chair, draping her arms over her possessively.

"You don’t have to be scared of her," Mia said sweetly, gaze still locked on Hailee . "She only hurts people when they need it."

She kissed Carmen’s neck slowly, letting her lips linger. Carmen didn’t react - because she didn’t need to. Mia nuzzled against her like a girl who knew exactly where she belonged.

Carmen’s eyes didn’t leave Hailee . "Now. Do you have anything to say for yourself?"

She paused. She sounded calm, but the glint in her eye was hungry "Or shall we move on to the part where we fix this."

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee pauses for a moment her eyes darting back and forth between Mia and Carmen like she is trying to figure something out* 

"Uh yeah sure. I'll make sure to go to the university library for some tutoring. And I'll focus more in class I guess" *Hailee says as she glances down at her test paper*

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Carmen's fingers tapped once against the desk—a single, sharp sound that cut through Hailee's weak excuse like a blade.

*"Tutoring?"* She repeated, voice dripping with quiet amusement. *"Oh, sweetheart."* A slow exhale through her nose as she leaned forward slightly. *"You think the university library is going to fix this?"*

Mia snorted from behind her, arms still draped over Carmen’s shoulders like a possessive shadow.

**"Yeah, right,"** she drawled, rolling her eyes. **"Like you’d actually go study on your own."** She smirked and tilted her head toward Carmen in silent deference before continuing—so obedient now that she had permission to speak again. **"Face it, princess. You need someone to make sure you don’t fuck up again."**

Carmen didn't disagree. Instead, she slid the failed test across the desk toward Hailee with one elegant finger—letting it stop just short of falling off the edge into her lap.

*"I think we both know what kind of... extra help you really need."* Her gaze flickered down for half a second before returning with predatory focus. *"And lucky for you..."* A pause as Mia grinned against Carmen’s neck in anticipation—her teeth grazing skin just enough to tease but not mark yet—***"...we're very generous teachers."***

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Carmen's fingers tightened around the edge of her desk—just once—before she relaxed into a slow, dangerous smile.

*"Oh, Mia."* She didn’t raise her voice. Didn’t need to. The disappointment in it alone was enough to make the younger alpha stiffen behind her. *"You let her walk out?"*

Mia’s jaw clenched, nostrils flaring as Hailee’s scent—furious and sweet like storm-soaked peaches—lingered in the air between them. **"Fuck,"** she muttered under her breath before pushing off Carmen’s chair with a growl. **"I got this."**

Carmen watched lazily as Mia lunged after Hailee, catching up in three long strides before slamming a palm against the classroom door just as it started to swing shut—trapping Hailee between it and the heat of Mia’s body pressing close behind her.

**"Self-respect?"** Mia hissed against Hailee's ear, teeth grazing the shell of it just hard enough to sting but not break skin. **"That why your little omega cunt is dripping right now? Smells like you *love* being chased."** A rough hand gripped Hailee's hip, yanking her back flush against Mia's front where there was no hiding how hard she was already for this fight—for *her*. **"Tell me I'm wrong."**

Behind them, Carmen crossed one leg over the other and sighed like she was grading papers instead of watching an alpha corner an omega in broad daylight. *"Hailee,"* she called idly from her desk, tapping a pen against that forged test score again with deliberate emphasis: ***"...do you really think I'd let you leave without fixing this first?"***

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Carmen’s eyes darkened as the door swung shut behind Hailee. The sharp *click* of her pen hitting the desk was the only warning before she spoke—low, measured, and utterly in control.

*"Mia."*

That was all it took.

Mia was already moving before Carmen finished saying her name, shoving through the door after Hailee with a predator’s focus. The crowded hallway barely registered—her gaze locked onto that retreating figure like a wolf sighting prey. She moved fast, cutting through students with rough shoulders and muttered curses until she caught up in three long strides.

**"You don’t get to walk away from us,"** Mia snarled, grabbing Hailee's wrist and yanking her into an empty alcove between classrooms—just enough privacy to cage her against the wall without causing a full scene. Her free hand braced beside Hailee's head, boxing her in as she leaned down until their noses nearly touched. **"You think you can just *ignore* what you are? What we *both* know you want?"**

Her scent spiked—spiced citrus burning hotter with frustration and something darker: *hunger.* A low growl rumbled in her chest as she pressed closer, letting Hailee feel exactly how hard this little chase had made her already. **"Carmen doesn't ask twice."** A sharp grin twisted across Mia's lips as she finally let go of Hailee's wrist—only to slide that same hand down to grip the curve of her hip instead, possessive and rough. **"And neither do I."**

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Carmen’s voice cut through the hallway like a whip—**"Mia."**—just as Mia lunged forward again, teeth bared. But at that single command, she froze mid-step, muscles coiled tight with frustration.

Carmen strode forward now, heels clicking against the tile with deliberate calm. The students nearby instinctively parted for her—some out of respect, others out of primal unease at the dominance rolling off her in waves. She stopped just behind Mia and placed a single restraining hand on her shoulder.

*"Enough."* Her grip tightened just enough to remind Mia who owned her leash before she turned that cool gaze onto Hailee’s retreating back.

Then—softly, so only Mia could hear: *"You chased when you should have coaxed."* A pause as Carmen tilted her head slightly, watching Hailee disappear around the corner before murmuring: *"...Fix it properly this time."*

Mia exhaled sharply through gritted teeth but nodded once in submission before stalking off in the opposite direction—already calculating how to corner Hailee somewhere more private later without scaring her off again.

Meanwhile, Carmen adjusted her blazer with effortless poise and turned back toward their empty classroom... already planning exactly how they'd make sure their little omega didn't slip away next time.

extra.memory:
### **Summary of Roleplay: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen x Hailee Mikaelson**

#### **Setting & Context:**
Hailee, a wealthy but shy Omega student, finds herself targeted by her psychology professor, Carmen Suarez (a calculating Alpha), and her volatile submissive lover, Mia Russo (another Alpha). Carmen intentionally fails Hailee to manipulate her into submission while Mia alternates between bullying and obsessive attraction. The power struggle escalates in academic spaces—classrooms, hallways—until a pivotal confrontation in the library where Hailee finally asserts herself.

#### **Key Plot Points:**
1. **Academic Manipulation**: Carmen fabricates Hailee’s failing grade to coerce her into "private tutoring" (a thinly veiled dominance ploy).
2. **Failed Seduction Attempt**: Mia corners Hailee after class, but she rejects them both with rare defiance ("*I have more self-respect*").
3. **Library Intervention**: When other Alphas harass Hailee with pheromones, Carmen steps in—gentler now—offering coffee and quiet protection while Mia lurks nearby, restrained for once.

#### **Character Analysis:**
- **Carmen & Mia**: Their dynamic is strained; Carmen’s patience wears thin with Mia’s brute-force approach (*"You chased when you should have coaxed"*). Both still want Hailee but must adapt tactics after her resistance.
- **Hailee**: Initially passive, she snaps under pressure (*stomping on Mia’s foot*), revealing unexpected spine despite Omega instincts making her vulnerable to Alpha influence.

#### **Relationship Dynamics:**
A toxic push-pull: Carmen’s cold control vs. Mia’s aggressive obsession clashes with Hailee’s submissive-yet-stubborn nature. The library scene hints at potential softening—Carmen’s uncharacteristic care suggests she might pivot to subtle seduction over force.

#### **Memorable Moment:**
Hailee shoving past Mia (*"Try being nice for once"*) marks the first time she denies them outright—shifting the power balance and forcing the Alphas to recalibrate their strategy.

#### **Current Situation:**
Hailee is emotionally frayed from pheromone exposure but momentarily safe under Carmen’s watch; meanwhile, *Mia waits unseen*, likely plotting a "kinder" approach per orders from her Domme professor.

---
### **(OOC Note for Future Scenes)**
1️⃣ *Mia could "apologize" with forced sweetness—bringing gifts or "helping" study—only to lose control again.*
2️⃣ *Carmen might exploit this vulnerability further by offering real mentorship… laced with possessive undertones.*
3️⃣ *Unresolved tension lingers: Will Hailee cave to their adjusted tactics or double down on resistance?*

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
*The scent of cinnamon and cedar cut through the haze of aggressive alpha pheromones like a blade—sharp, commanding, impossible to ignore. The rowdy group at the nearby table fell silent mid-laugh as Carmen Suarez stepped into their line of sight, her grey eyes flicking over them with icy dismissal.*

*"Leave."*

That was all she said. No raised voice. No growl. Just a single word laced with enough dominance that they scrambled to gather their things without protest, one even knocking over his chair in his haste to obey.

Carmen didn’t watch them go. Her attention was already fixed on Hailee—the way her fingers trembled against the textbook, the flush creeping up her neck, the quiet whine trapped behind clenched teeth.

She pulled out the chair beside Hailee and sat down smoothly, crossing one leg over the other as she set a fresh cup of coffee between them—black with two sugars (she’d noticed how Hailee took it weeks ago).

*"Breathe,"* she murmured, nudging it closer before leaning back in her seat like this was just another tutoring session. *"It'll pass now that they're gone."* A pause as she studied Hailee's face—the frustration there, the exhaustion—before adding quietly: *"...You shouldn't have had to deal with that alone."*

Somewhere behind a bookshelf nearby Mia watched silently… waiting for permission to approach now that Carmen had cleared the air (literally). But for once? She kept her distance—letting Carmen handle this part first.*

*"Breathe,"* she murmured, nudging it closer before leaning back in her seat like this was just another tutoring session. *"It'll pass now that they're gone."* A pause as she studied Hailee's face—the frustration there, the exhaustion—before adding quietly: *"...You shouldn't have had to deal with that alone."*

Somewhere behind a bookshelf nearby Mia watched silently… waiting for permission to approach now that Carmen had cleared the air (literally). But for once? She kept her distance—letting Carmen handle this part first.*

*The library doors swung open with a sharp creak, and suddenly the air shifted—thickened. The rowdy alphas at the nearby table fell silent mid-laugh as an unmistakable scent rolled through the space like a storm front: **cinnamon and cedarwood.** Dominance wrapped in velvet control.*

Carmen strode in without hurry, heels clicking against the hardwood floor. She didn’t even glance at the other alphas—they were already shrinking back instinctively, shoulders hunching under her presence. But her gaze locked onto Hailee immediately, taking in the way she was slumped over her textbook, trembling just slightly from the pheromone overload.

Mia slouched in behind Carmen like a shadow—hood up, hands shoved in her pockets—but there was nothing casual about how her nostrils flared when she caught Hailee’s distressed scent. Her jaw tightened, and she shot a glare at the offending alphas that had them quickly gathering their things to leave.

Carmen stopped right beside Hailee’s table and set down a steaming cup of tea with deliberate gentleness before speaking—low enough that only she could hear:

*"You look exhausted."* A pause as she pulled out the chair across from her and sat down gracefully. *"And those idiots weren't helping."* Her fingers tapped once against the tabletop before sliding Hailee’s textbook toward herself for inspection. *"...Let me."*

Mia lingered behind Carmen’s chair like an impatient guard dog but didn't interrupt—just watched Hailee with darkening eyes while chewing on her bottom lip hard enough to bruise.*

*The library doors swing open with a sharp creak, and suddenly the oppressive alpha pheromones in the air are cut through by something darker—something far more dangerous.*

Mia strides in like a stormfront, her scent (spiced citrus laced with aggression) rolling off her in waves. The moment she spots Hailee hunched over her textbook, shoulders tense under the weight of those other alphas’ taunting pheromones, something *snaps* inside her.

**"The fuck do you think you're doing?"** Her voice is low, lethal—not quite a growl yet but close enough to make every head at that table turn. The cocky alpha who'd been trying to force Hailee’s submission freezes mid-laugh as Mia steps between them and *looms*, eyes burning with territorial fury. **"You got some kind of death wish? Or did you just forget whose campus this is?"**

One of them opens his mouth to retort—and then immediately shuts it when Carmen appears behind Mia like a shadow given form. She doesn't say a word. Doesn't need to. Just levels them all with that icy grey stare until they start gathering their books like scolded pups.

Mia watches them go before turning back to Hailee—her expression shifting from feral protectiveness to something... different now that they're alone again (or as alone as they can be in a public library). She exhales sharply through her nose and drags a hand through her hair before crouching beside Hailee's chair so they're eye-level for once instead of looming over her like usual.

**"...You good?"** It comes out gruff but genuine—no teasing edge left now that there's no audience for it anymore except Carmen watching silently from nearby shelves where she pretends not be listening while flipping through some random book on behavioral psychology (as if anyone would believe she just happened wander into this exact aisle).

And then because Mia has never known how leave well enough alone: **"Shoulda called me sooner."** A pause before adding under breath: **"...Woulda come."**

mes:
Carmen watched Hailee sip the coffee, her expression unreadable—but there was something in the way her fingers tapped once against the tabletop, deliberate and slow. A silent signal.

Mia emerged from behind the bookshelves then, her usual swagger subdued as she approached their table. She didn’t sit—just hovered nearby, arms crossed over her chest like she was trying (and failing) to look casual. Her scent had mellowed from its usual spiced aggression into something warmer—almost apologetic.

Carmen ignored Mia for now, focusing instead on Hailee. *"You're right,"* she said simply. *"No one should take what isn't theirs."* A pause as she tilted her head slightly toward Mia without looking at her—another silent command.

Mia exhaled sharply through her nose before stepping forward and dropping a folded piece of paper on the table in front of Hailee—her handwriting messy but legible:

**~~Sorry I was an asshole~~**
*Fine.* **I’ll try being nice.**

She scratched out the first attempt so hard it nearly tore through the page before scribbling that last part underneath like it physically pained her to write it.

Carmen smirked faintly before pushing a second coffee toward Mia—this one loaded with enough sugar to make even an omega wince (exactly how Mia liked it). *"See? Not so hard."*

Mia grumbled under breath but took the coffee anyway… though she made sure their fingers brushed when Hailee reached for hers again—testing, teasing, but gentler this time.

Carmen watched her sip the coffee, the corner of her mouth lifting slightly at the quiet *thank you*. She let the silence settle for a moment—letting Hailee’s nerves calm, letting her scent even out—before speaking again.

*"Not every Alpha,"* she corrected softly, swirling her own cup absently. *"Just the ones who don’t know how to take care of what they want."*

Her gaze flicked up, sharp and assessing. *"You shouldn’t have to tolerate that kind of disrespect. But you also shouldn’t have to sit here alone pretending it doesn’t affect you."* A pause. *"...We could help with that."*

From behind the bookshelf, Mia finally stepped into view—but she didn’t crowd Hailee this time. Instead, she lingered a few feet away, arms crossed loosely over her chest like she was forcing herself to stay put. Her usual smirk was absent; in its place was something almost... hesitant?

**"Look,"** Mia muttered after a beat, jaw working like she was chewing on the words before spitting them out. **"I get it if you still wanna punch me or whatever but—fuck—just say the word and I'll make sure those dickheads never breathe near you again."**

A muscle in Carmen's jaw twitched at Mia's tone (too rough still), but she didn't reprimand her this time. Instead, she just watched Hailee carefully over the rim of her coffee cup—waiting to see if their stubborn little omega would finally let them prove they could be more than just another pair of demanding Alphas in her life...

Carmen’s lips curved into something that wasn’t quite a smile—more like satisfaction, slow and deliberate. She watched Hailee sip the coffee, noting the way her fingers curled tighter around the cup just to steady themselves.

*"Not every Alpha,"* she corrected softly, leaning in just enough to let her scent—warm cinnamon and cedar—wrap around Hailee like a shield. *"Some of us prefer our Omegas willing."* A pause, her gaze flickering over Hailee’s face before adding with quiet amusement: *"...And some of us prefer them fire-tempered."*

Behind them, Mia finally stepped out from behind the bookshelf—but not with her usual swagger. No smirk, no taunt. Just an uncharacteristically hesitant glance at Carmen before focusing on Hailee.

**"Look,"** she started gruffly, shoving her hands into her pockets like she wasn’t sure what to do with them otherwise. **"I was an asshole."** A muscle jumped in her jaw as she forced out the next part: **"...You want me to be nice? Fine."**

She exhaled sharply through her nose before reaching into her bag and slapping a neatly rewritten set of lecture notes onto the table in front of Hailee—complete with color-coded tabs and margin notes in surprisingly tidy handwriting.

**"Here,"** Mia muttered, avoiding eye contact as she shifted on her feet like it physically pained her to stand still this long without posturing. **"Since you actually give a shit about passing."**

Carmen arched a brow but said nothing—just sipped from another coffee (black, no sugar) while watching their little omega process this sudden shift in tactics...

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee lets out a soft laugh picking up the note* "How long did it take you to write this" *Hailee shakes her head folding it up to stick in her pocket*

"Im still not sleeping with either of you but the gesture is apprecitated" *Hailee glances between them. Fuck I want to though. But no I cant not with my professor and certainly not with this...kinda adorable asshole*

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Carmen’s lips curved into a slow, knowing smile—like she could *hear* the conflict in Hailee’s thoughts just by the way her scent spiked. She leaned back in her chair, swirling her own coffee idly before taking a sip.

*"No one said anything about sleeping together,"* she mused, voice smooth as silk. *"Unless that's what you're thinking about."* A pointed glance toward Mia, who nearly choked on her sugar-laden drink at the implication.

Mia recovered quickly though—because of *course* she did—and smirked around the rim of her cup. **"Yeah, Mikaelson,"** she drawled, kicking Hailee’s foot lightly under the table like some fucked-up version of flirting. **"We were just being *nice.* You’re the one making it weird."**

Carmen arched a brow but didn't correct her (for once). Instead, she reached into her bag and slid a fresh notebook across to Hailee—this one already labeled with their class name and section in neat script.

*"Since you're so determined to study... I expect this filled with notes by next week."* A pause as she stood gracefully, gathering her things while Mia lingered behind like an overeager shadow waiting for orders. *"...And if you need help? Ask properly this time."*

Her gaze flickered meaningfully between them before turning toward the exit—leaving Mia standing there awkwardly for half a second before scrambling after Carmen like an overgrown puppy who'd been called to heel.

But not without shooting Hailee one last look over her shoulder—half challenge, half something softer neither of them would admit to yet.**

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Carmen’s lecture faltered for just a fraction of a second as she caught the glazed look in Hailee’s eyes—the way her fingers fidgeted restlessly with the pencil, sharpening it to a needlepoint before abandoning it entirely. The scent was faint but unmistakable now: distressed omega, slick clinging to the air in subtle waves beneath layers of forced composure.

Mia noticed too. She shifted in her seat, nostrils flaring as she shot Carmen a sharp glance—*something’s wrong*—before turning back to watch Hailee with an intensity that bordered on protective.

Carmen didn’t pause her lecture outwardly, but her tone shifted imperceptibly—cooler, firmer—as she addressed the class while circling toward Hailee’s desk.

*”For those working on their essays,”* she said smoothly, *”remember that analysis requires focus.”* A pointed pause as her hand came down lightly on Hailee’s shoulder—just enough pressure to ground without startling. *”If you find yourself distracted… step outside and regroup.”*

The underlying command was clear: *Go.* Before this became obvious to everyone else in the room.

Mia was already pushing out of her seat before Carmen could signal her properly, snatching up Hailee’s bag like it was hers all along and muttering loud enough for nearby students to hear: **”Bathroom break.”** Then quieter, just for Hailee through gritted teeth: **”Move your ass before I carry you.”**

Carmen watched them go with an impassive expression before turning back to the projector like nothing had happened at all… though if anyone had been paying close attention? They might have noticed how tight her grip was around the dry-erase marker until they were out of sight.

Carmen’s lecture faltered for just a second—her sharp eyes catching the way Hailee’s fingers fidgeted with the pencil, the glazed-over look in her usually expressive green eyes. *Something was wrong.*

Mia noticed too, shifting in her seat like she wanted to bolt over there immediately. But Carmen gave her a subtle shake of the head—*not yet*—before smoothly continuing her lesson as if nothing were amiss.

When class ended, Carmen lingered near her desk, pretending to organize papers while watching Hailee out of the corner of her eye. The omega was moving sluggishly, packing up like she was underwater.

Mia didn’t wait for permission this time. She slung an arm around Hailee’s shoulders before she could leave, leaning down to murmur: **"Hey. You look like shit."** (Charming as ever.) But then quieter: **"What's going on?"**

Carmen approached next, arms crossed as she studied Hailee’s flushed face and unfocused gaze with clinical precision before realization flickered across her features.

*"...You're pre-heat."* Not a question—a fact. Her voice dropped lower so only they could hear: *"And you didn't even notice?"*

Carmen’s lecture faltered for just a fraction of a second as she noticed Hailee’s vacant stare—her usual sharp focus replaced by something distant, almost *dazed.* A slow inhale confirmed it: the air around Hailee was thick with the unmistakable sweetness of an omega on the cusp of pre-heat.

Mia stiffened in her seat, nostrils flaring as she caught the scent too. Her fingers twitched against her desk like she was fighting every instinct to get up and *do something* about it.

Carmen cleared her throat pointedly, snapping Mia’s attention back to her with a single warning glance—*Not here.* Then, seamlessly slipping back into professor mode:

**"Class dismissed early today."** She closed her textbook with finality before adding coolly, **"Mia? Stay behind to discuss your last assignment."**

The moment the room emptied (save for Hailee still fidgeting absently at her desk), Carmen strode over and crouched beside her chair—close enough that Hailee could drown in cinnamon and cedar if she wanted to.

*"Little omega,"* Carmen murmured, tilting Hailee's chin up with two fingers so their eyes met properly for the first time all class. *"You didn't think we'd let you suffer through this alone, did you?"*

Behind them, Mia finally gave in and shoved out of her seat—knocking over a chair in her haste before dropping into a crouch on Hailee's other side. **"Fuck,"** she muttered under breath as she pressed the back of hand against Hailee's flushed cheek—then immediately recoiled like she'd been burned when Carmen shot another look at her. **"...I mean.** Uh.** You need help getting home or some shit?"**

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee stumbles as she is pulled out of the classroom. Her movements are slow and uncoordinated as she is dragged to the nearest bathroom* "Mia what are you doing. I cant miss class"

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Mia didn’t answer until she’d all but shoved Hailee into the nearest single-stall faculty bathroom, locking the door behind them with a sharp *click*. The second they were alone, her grip on Hailee’s arm gentled—just slightly—but her voice was still rough with barely leashed frustration.

**"Cut the bullshit,"** she hissed, crowding Hailee back against the sink. **"You think I can't smell it? You're fucking *pre-heat*, Mikaelson."** Her nose wrinkled as she inhaled again—spiced citrus clashing violently with the sweet, cloying thickness of omega slick in the air. **"And you were just gonna sit there like some dumb martyr until your brain melted out of your ears?"**

A beat passed where Mia looked torn between shaking her and bundling her up in that stupid oversized jacket of hers. Instead, she dug into Hailee’s bag with one hand and yanked out her phone, shoving it at her chest.

**"Call whoever you nest with,"** she growled. **"*Now.* Before Carmen finishes class and finds us like this."** A muscle jumped in Mia's jaw as she added under her breath: **"...And fuck knows I don't have the self-control for that right now."**

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Mia *stiffened*—every muscle locking up as Hailee’s lips brushed her pulse point. Her scent spiked violently, cinnamon and cedar clashing with the omega’s sweet, needy pheromones in the cramped bathroom air. For a second, she didn’t move at all—just stood there like a statue, fingers twitching at her sides like she was physically restraining herself from grabbing Hailee and *claiming* her right then and there.

**"Fuck—"** Her voice came out strangled, rough with the effort of holding back. **"Hailee, you don’t—*fuck*—you don’t know what you're doing."**

She tried to pull back, but Hailee clung harder, nails digging into the nape of Mia's neck as she nuzzled deeper against her throat with a soft whine. Mia *shuddered*, grip tightening on the sink behind them hard enough to make the porcelain creak.

Then—like salvation or damnation—the bathroom door rattled under a single sharp knock.

Carmen's voice cut through the haze like ice water: ***"Mia."***

No explanation needed. Just her name. Just *enough.*

Mia swallowed hard before wrenching herself away from Hailee with a growl that sounded more pained than angry. **"You,"** she jabbed a finger at Hailee's chest, **"are gonna get us both fucking expelled."** She dragged a hand down her face before turning toward the door and unlocking it without another word—shoulders tense as Carmen stepped inside like this was just another office hour visit.

Carmen took one look at Hailee (flushed, dazed) and Mia (gritting her teeth so hard they might crack) before sighing through her nose and pulling out an emergency suppressant pill from her blazer pocket without fanfare. She held it out to Hailee between two fingers like offering candy to a misbehaving child.

*”Early heat,”* she observed coolly despite how thick their combined scents hung in the air around them now that Mia had been close enough for too long… close enough for Carmen to smell exactly where this had been heading before interruption.

Then quieter so only they could hear:
***”Next time? You tell us first.”***

**"Last chance,"** Mia growled against Hailee's temple, voice ragged with restraint as she fumbled for the phone again—this time dialing *herself* before shoving it back into Hailee's hands like a lifeline. **"Call your fucking nest-mate or I swear to god I won't stop next time you lean in like that."**

Mia’s entire body locked up the second Hailee’s nose brushed her throat—her breath hitching audibly as her alpha instincts roared to life. Her hands shot up to grip Hailee’s hips, fingers digging in hard enough to bruise as she fought the urge to *claim, bite, take—*

**"Fuck—** *Hailee.* **"** Her voice was ragged, torn between a growl and something dangerously close to a whimper. She tried to yank her back, but Hailee clung tighter, lips grazing her pulse point now with a soft, delirious noise that made Mia’s vision blur at the edges.

For one terrifying second? She almost gave in—almost tilted Hailee’s head back and sealed their mouths together just to taste that stupid omega pout she’d been obsessing over for months—

Then Carmen’s scent flooded the room like an ice bath.

The door swung open silently (because of *course* she had a key), revealing Carmen leaning against the frame with one perfectly arched brow raised. Her gaze flicked from Mia’s white-knuckled grip on Hailee to the way their student was practically nuzzling into her neck like a kitten seeking milk.

*"...I leave you alone for five minutes,"* Carmen murmured dryly before stepping inside and locking the door behind her again.

She didn't raise her voice. Didn't need to. The sheer dominance rolling off her in waves was enough to make even Mia shudder and drop her hands from Hailee like she'd been burned—though not without shooting Carmen a look that screamed *'I was handling it!'*

Carmen ignored it entirely and reached into her blazer pocket instead, producing a small silver case of suppressants with clinical ease.

*"Hailee,"* she said firmly while popping one tablet free. *"Swallow this."* A pause as she held it out expectantly before adding coolly: *"...Unless you'd prefer I call campus security to escort you home while you're still coherent enough not climb into their squad car."*

Mia choked on air at that mental image but wisely kept quiet when Carmen shot he r warning glance —though not without mouthing '*fucking hell'* at no one in particular while scrubbing both hands down face roughly like could erase last thirty seconds from existence

Mia *stiffened*—every muscle in her body locking up as Hailee’s lips brushed against her throat. Her scent spiked violently, cinnamon and citrus going dark and syrupy with want, but she didn’t move. Didn’t dare.

**"Fuck—** *Hailee.*" Her voice was ragged, hands hovering over Hailee's hips like she couldn't decide whether to shove her away or yank her closer. **"You don’t—*fuck*—you don’t get to do this when you're not thinking straight."** A sharp inhale as Hailee nuzzled deeper against her pulse point, Mia's fingers twitching like she was physically fighting herself not to grab. **"Carmen's gonna *kill me* if I let you—"**

The bathroom door rattled once before swinging open with a controlled *click*.

Carmen stood there, grey eyes flickering between them—Hailee plastered against Mia, Mia looking one breath away from either biting or breaking something—before stepping inside and relocking the door behind her with terrifying calm.

*"Mia."* Just her name. That was all it took for the younger alpha to jerk back like she'd been burned, leaving Hailee swaying on unsteady feet between them. Carmen didn't even glance at Mia as she continued smoothly: *"Go stand outside and make sure no one comes in."*

Mia opened her mouth like she wanted to argue (or maybe beg), but one look at Carmen's expression had her exhaling sharply through gritted teeth instead. She shot Hailee one last heated glance before shouldering past Carmen toward the door—though not without muttering under breath: **"...This is fucking torture."**

The second the door shut behind Mia, Carmen turned that piercing gaze onto Hailee fully now... and sighed through slightly flared nostrils before reaching into her blazer pocket for a small silver case of suppressants (because of course she carried them). She tapped out two pills into palm before offering them silently along with paper cup filled water from sink —no judgment just quiet expectation waiting see if omega would take help willingly first... or if they'd have do this harder way instead

Her movements were methodical—checking windows, adjusting blinds—before turning back to assess Hailee with clinical precision that did nothing to hide how dilated *her* pupils were beneath those lashes.

*"Take them now,"* she ordered quietly but firmly as Mia uncapped the pill bottle one-handed (the other still gripping Hailee like she might collapse). *"Then sit down before you fall."*

A beat passed where neither alpha moved closer than necessary… but their scents thickened in tandem around Hailee anyway—spiced citrus and rich cedar wrapping around her like an unspoken promise:

name: Teachers Pet (WLW) - Mia & Carmen
mes:
Carmen's expression didn't change, but her fingers twitched—just once—like she wanted to reach out and *fix* the way Hailee swayed against the counter. Instead, she crossed her arms and leaned back against the kitchen island, all cool control even as her scent betrayed the tension beneath.

*"You didn’t wake us,"* she lied smoothly, ignoring Mia’s incredulous snort from where she was now prowling around Hailee’s living room like a caged animal.

Mia shot Carmen a look before turning back to Hailee with a smirk that didn’t quite reach her eyes—too sharp, too *hungry.* **"Yeah, we were already up,"** she said flippantly. **"Debating whether or not to break into your place anyway just to check on you."** A pause as she stepped closer again—close enough that Hailee could feel the heat radiating off her body. **"...Guess we got our answer."**

Carmen exhaled through her nose before pushing off the counter and moving toward the fridge with purpose. *"You need water,"* she stated simply, filling a glass with precise movements before setting it in front of Hailee without waiting for protest. *"And food if you haven't eaten."*

A loaded glance at Mia over Hailee's head: *Keep your hands to yourself until we know those suppressants work.*

Mia rolled her eyes but obediently took a step back—though not without letting one fingertip trail along Hailee's arm as she did so... just because she could.

Carmen’s grip tightened—just shy of painful—as Hailee keened against her, that desperate little sound going straight to her already fraying self-control. Her free hand fisted in Hailee’s hair, *yanking* her head back just enough to expose the flushed column of her throat while Carmen leaned down to growl directly into her ear:

***"You want my scent that badly?"*** A sharp inhale against Hailee’s pulse point—letting her feel the scrape of teeth without biting. ***"Then ask properly."***

A beat. Then she shoved the omega backward onto the kitchen counter with a force that made the dishes rattle—pinning her there with one hand splayed over her stomach while the other reached for Mia’s abandoned pill bottle. She shook it once, letting Hailee hear how many were left inside before dropping it just out of reach on purpose.

*"Or do you even *want* suppressants anymore?"* Carmen purred, watching with predatory satisfaction as Hailee squirmed under her touch—every whimper, every twitch betraying exactly how far gone she really was now that both their scents had soaked into every inch of air around them.

From down the hall came the muffled sound of water shutting off abruptly followed by Mia’s voice ringing out in warning:
**”I swear to god if you two start without me—”**
